document.docAuthor: Moghaddam, Mostafa Ghafouri, Rakhshani, Ehsan, Achterberg, Cornelis Van & Mokhtari, Azizollah
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic review of the genus Diolcogaster Ashmead (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) in Iran, distribution and morphological variability

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic review of the genus Diolcogaster Ashmead (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) in Iran, distribution and morphological variability

subSubSection.paragraph:
Microgaster mayae Shestakov, 1932: 260
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Microgaster iranensis
Hedwig, 1957 : 112
[SMNS, Figs 15 A–15D]. Synonymized with
D. mayae
by van Achterberg (1980) .
Protomicroplitis mayae
;
Tobias 1976 : 164
;
van Achterberg 1980 : 30
.

Redescription. FEMALE . 5 ♀ ( Iran , form A), length of body 3.3–3.5 mm ( Fig. 7A ), length of antenna 3.9–4.1 mm ( Fig. 7B ), length of fore wing 3.2–3.4 mm ( Fig. 8F ); 5 ♂ ( Iran , form A), length of body 3.1–3.3 mm ( Fig. 9A ), length of antenna 4.0– 4.2 mm ( Fig. 9B ), length of fore wing 3.2–3.4 mm ( Fig. 10F ).

Mesosoma .
Propodeum shiny, rugose anteriorly, smooth posteriorly, with an irregular medio-longitudinal carina and sparse long whitish setae antero-laterally, traces of transverse carina defined with rugose pattern ( Fig. 8B ).

Wings ( Fig. 8F ).
Fore wing vein R1 about 0.8× as long as pterostigma length, pterostigma 2.7× as long as wide, vein r of 1.6× as long as vein 2RS and slightly curved, vein r-m 1.7× 3RSa. Hind wing vein cu-a straight.
MALE . ( Figs 9–10 ). As female but with minor differences in colour and measurements.

Intraspecific variation. Different ‘forms’ of
Diolcogaster mayae
in Iran (designated forms A, B and C) was observed. Variations in colour and measurements are shown in Table 4 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 4. Comparison of the color variations in three forms of
Diolcogaster mayae (Shestakov, 1932)
in Iran.

tr.td: T3 completely yellow (Fig. 8C) and T4 yellow laterally and brown spot medially T5–T7 mostly brown (Fig. 8D).
Fore wing with pale spot in pterostigma (Fig. 8F).
Fore wing without pale spot in pterostigma (Fig. 12F).
Fore wing with pale spot in pterostigma (Fig. 14F).
Metatibiae whitish yellow anteriorly but brownish yellow posteriorly (Fig. 7C).

subSubSection.paragraph: Form B ( Figs 11–12 ): 5 ♀ , length of body 3.5–3.7 mm ( Fig. 11A ), length of antenna 4.1–4.3 mm ( Fig. 11B ), length of fore wing 2.9–3.3 mm ( Fig. 12F ); 5 ♂ , length of body 3.2–3.5 mm , length of antenna 4.2–4.5 mm , length of fore wing 3.1–3.4 mm .

Ecological notes. Hosts are unknown. Flight period was April to July, September and November, with peak in April. Collected in April–July and some specimens in September.

Distribution in Iran .
West Azarbaijan ( Telenga 1955 ); Sistan-o Baluchestan: Iranshahr ( Hedwig 1957 ), Khash, Nikshahr, Sarbaz and Zabol; Fars (
Gadallah et al. 2015
) and South Khorasan provinces: Giyouk ( new record ).

Geographic distribution ( Fig. 18A ). Palaearctic: Afghanistan , Algeria ( new record ), Armenia , Azerbaijan , Iran , Israel ( new record ), Kazakhstan , Mongolia , Romania , Russia ( new record ), Tajikistan , Turkmenistan , Uzbekistan . Afrotropical: Yemen ( new record ).

Similar species. The most similar species is
D. claritibia
, and, in colouration, it resembles
D. alvearia
